titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the Bureau of the Census on the 100th anniversary of its establishment.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 339.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 333.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/12/2002--Passed House without amendment. Recognizes the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the Bureau of the Census. Acknowledges the achievements and contributions of the Bureau of the Census, and of its current and former employees, to the United States.
